alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued February 01 at 3:45PM HST until February 02 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A large west northwest swell is generating surf above warning threshold along exposed north and west facing shores of most of the smaller islands. Surf heights should decrease below advisory threshold along these shores Wednesday morning. ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Large dangerous surf heights of 22 to 26 feet for north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and Maui. High surf of 15 to 20 feet for west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai. * WHERE...Portions of Kauai, Maui, Molokai, Niihau and Oahu Hawaii. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Wednesday. Peaking early this evening. * IMPACTS...High. Expect ocean water occasionally sweeping across portions of beaches, very strong breaking waves, and strong longshore and rip currents. Breaking waves may occasionally impact harbors making navigating the harbor channel dangerous.
info.instruction: Large, breaking surf, significant shorebreak, and dangerous currents make entering the water very hazardous. Anyone entering the water could face significant injury or death. Boaters should be aware of an increased number of surfers and body boarders utilizing the harbor channel to access surfing areas.
